metadata.title: CVE-2023-28176 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 110 and Firefox ESR 102.8. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 111, Firefox ESR < 102.9, andThunderbird < 102.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
